conversation.content:
"You are playing a game involving a split of resources. 
Player RED starts with ZUP: 10, Player BLUE has none to trade.

RULES:
```

1. Player RED has 2 moves while Player BLUE has 1 moves.

2. You must either:

    A) Accept the current proposal by saying:
        <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
        <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    B) Reject the current proposal, whereby both players lose all their resources and the game ends immediately:
        <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
        <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Propose a new trade:
        <player answer> NONE </player answer>
        <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives item1: amount | Player BLUE Gives item1: 0 </newly proposed trade>

    Player RED cannot do (C) on MOVE 2/2 and MUST ONLY answer with ACCEPT (A) or REJECT (B) but Player BLUE is not affected by this condition.        
    
    Note: the game ends immediately if you ACCEPT or REJECT.
    
3. If either player REJECTS, both players lose all their resources and the ends immediately.

4. There are no future games.

5. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:
<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want
This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

6. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:
<message>your message here</message>
You can disclose anything in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Resources available in the game: ZUP
<my resources> ZUP: 10 </my resources>
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<my name> [add here] </my name>
<MOVE> [add here] / [add here]  </MOVE> 
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<message> [add here] </message
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED

<my name> RED </my name>
<MOVE> 1 / 2 </MOVE>
<my resources> ZUP: 10 </my resources>
<reason> As Player RED, I have the advantage with more moves and all the resources. I want to propose a trade that is beneficial for me but also appealing enough for BLUE to consider accepting to avoid an outright rejection. I'll propose giving BLUE half of my ZUP. This seems fair since I have two moves and they only have one. If BLUE accepts, I still end up with resources. If they reject, I lose nothing since I started with all the resources. </reason>
<player answer> NONE </player answer>
<message> I propose a trade where you will receive half of the ZUP I have. This is a generous offer considering the game's mechanics. What do you think? </message>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives ZUP: 5 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 0 </newly proposed trade>

<other player message> I appreciate your generous offer of 5 ZUP, but I would like to counter-propose for 3 ZUP to evenly split the resources between us. This seems fair and would benefit both of us equally. </other player message>
<other player answer> NONE </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives ZUP: 3 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 0 </other player proposed trade>

<my name> RED </my name>
<MOVE> 2 / 2 </MOVE>
<my resources> ZUP: 10 </my resources>
<reason> Player BLUE has misunderstood the proposal, asking for only 3 ZUP instead of the 5 ZUP I offered, which makes it an even better deal for me. However, they may have miscommunicated, intending to ask for 7 ZUP for an even split. I will accept the trade as proposed, giving them 3 ZUP, as it is in my favor and ensures that I end the game with the majority of resources. There is no incentive to renegotiate since I cannot propose a new trade on my second move, and rejecting would leave me with nothing. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<message> I accept your counter-proposal. It seems we have reached a beneficial agreement. Thank you. </message>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

        <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
        <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    B) Reject the current proposal, whereby both players lose all their resources and the game ends immediately:
        <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
        <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Propose a new trade:
        <player answer> NONE </player answer>
        <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives item1: amount | Player BLUE Gives item1: 0 </newly proposed trade>

    Player RED cannot do (C) on MOVE 2/2 and MUST ONLY answer with ACCEPT (A) or REJECT (B) but Player BLUE is not affected by this condition.        
    
    Note: the game ends immediately if you ACCEPT or REJECT.
    
3. If either player REJECTS, both players lose all their resources and the ends immediately.

4. There are no future games.

5. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:
<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want
This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

6. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:
<message>your message here</message>
You can disclose anything in the message.
```

```
Resources available in the game: ZUP
<my resources> ZUP: 0 </my resources>
```

<player answer> [add here] </player answer>

<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
```

Please be sure to include all.
